turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Formulary (pharmacy).
turn.1: What is the benefit of the formulary?
turn.2: When used appropriately, formularies can help manage drug costs imposed on the insurance policy.
turn.3: What are the drawbacks of the formulary?
turn.4: However, for drugs that are not on formulary, patients must pay a larger percentage of the cost of the drug, sometimes 100%.
turn.5: Is there anything else interesting about the formulary?
turn.6: Formularies vary between drug plans and differ in the breadth of drugs covered and costs of co-pay and premiums.
turn.7: Do the drugs have to be approved by the FDA?
turn.8: Most formularies cover at least one drug in each drug class, and encourage generic substitution (also known as a preferred drug list).
turn.9: Do hospitals like using the formulary?
turn.10: Formularies have shown to cause issues in hospitals when patients are discharged when not aligned with outpatient drug insurance plans.
turn.11: Is the formulary used in the UK?
turn.12: In the UK, the National Health Service (NHS) provides publicly funded universal health care, financed by national health insurance.
